nodes.documentation:
@notice This interface defines the functions for a lending pool that holds all of the tokens that lenders transfer into the protocol.
@author develop@teller.finance
nodes.name: LendingPoolInterface
deposit
withdraw
repay
liquidationPayment
createLoan
withdrawInterest

nodes.documentation:
@notice It gets the lending token address.
@return the ERC20 lending token address.
nodes.name: lendingToken

nodes.documentation:
@notice Gets the current interest validator. By default it is 0x0.
@return the interest validator contract address or empty address (0x0).
nodes.name: interestValidator

nodes.documentation:
@notice Update the current interest validator address.
@param newInterestValidator the new interest validator address.
nodes.name: setInterestValidator
TokenDeposited
TokenWithdrawn
TokenRepaid
InterestWithdrawn
PaymentLiquidated
InterestValidatorUpdated

nodes.documentation:
@notice This interface defines the functions for a lending pool that holds all of the tokens that lenders transfer into the protocol.
@author develop@teller.finance
nodes.name: LendingPoolInterface
deposit
withdraw
repay
liquidationPayment
createLoan
withdrawInterest

nodes.documentation:
@notice It gets the lending token address.
@return the ERC20 lending token address.
nodes.name: lendingToken

nodes.documentation:
@notice Gets the current interest validator. By default it is 0x0.
@return the interest validator contract address or empty address (0x0).
nodes.name: interestValidator

nodes.documentation:
@notice Update the current interest validator address.
@param newInterestValidator the new interest validator address.
nodes.name: setInterestValidator
TokenDeposited
TokenWithdrawn
TokenRepaid
InterestWithdrawn
PaymentLiquidated
InterestValidatorUpdated

createLoan(uint256,address).details: This function only can be invoked by the LoansInterface implementation.It throws a require error if current ERC20 balance isn't enough to transfer the tokens.

params.borrower: address which will receive the tokens.

deposit(uint256).details: the user must call ERC20.approve function previously.

params.amount: of tokens to deposit in the pool.

interestValidator().return: the interest validator contract address or empty address (0x0).

liquidationPayment(uint256,address).details: It throws a require error if this contract hasn't enough token balance.

repay(uint256,address).details: This function can be called ONLY by the Loans contract.It requires a ERC20.approve call before calling it.It throws a require error if borrower called ERC20.approve function before calling it.

params.borrower: address that is repaying the loan.

withdraw(uint256).details: It throws a require error if the contract hasn't enough tokens balance.It throws a require error if the holder hasn't enough tToken balance.

withdrawInterest(uint256).details: It throws a require error if amount exceeds the current accrued interest.

createLoan(uint256,address).notice: Once the loan is created, it transfers the amount of tokens to the borrower.

deposit(uint256).notice: It allows users to deposit tokens into the pool.

interestValidator().notice: Gets the current interest validator. By default it is 0x0.

lendingToken().notice: It gets the lending token address.

liquidationPayment(uint256,address).notice: Once a loan is liquidated, it transfers the amount of tokens to the liquidator address.

repay(uint256,address).notice: It allows a borrower repaying their loan.

setInterestValidator(address).notice: Update the current interest validator address.

withdraw(uint256).notice: It allows any tToken holder to burn their tToken tokens and withdraw their tokens.

withdrawInterest(uint256).notice: It allows a lender to withdraw a specific amount of interest.

userdoc.notice: This interface defines the functions for a lending pool that holds all of the tokens that lenders transfer into the protocol.
